qas.question: On what is agriculture almost completely dependent?
What family of plants is most important for human sustenance?
What is the more common name of the Fabaceae?
What family do potatoes, tomatoes and peppers belong to?
What family would you find cherries in?

plausible_answers.text: providing the bulk of all feedstocks

qas.question: What does the legume family provide as the most important of all the plant families?
What is the more common name of the Solanaceae family that is second place?

plausible_answers.text: a significant amount of livestock feed

qas.question: What does the rue family provide that is needed for livestock?

plausible_answers.text: rice, corn — maize, wheat, barley, rye

qas.question: What are some examples of what the nightshade family provides as the most important group?
What does the rue family provide that makes it one group of high importance?

context: Agriculture is almost entirely dependent on <a0_0>angiosperms<a0_0/>, which provide virtually all plant-based food, and also provide <b7_0>a significant amount of livestock feed<b7_0/>. Of all the families of plants, the <a1_0>Poaceae<a1_0/>, or grass family (grains), is by far the most important, <b5_0>providing the bulk of all feedstocks<b5_0/> (<b8_0>rice, corn — maize, wheat, barley, rye<b8_0/>, oats, pearl millet, sugar cane, sorghum). The Fabaceae, or <a2_0><b6_0>legume<a2_0/> family<b6_0/>, comes in second place. Also of high importance are the <a3_0>Solanaceae<a3_0/>, or nightshade family <b9_0>(potatoes, tomatoes, and peppers, among others)<b9_0/>, the Cucurbitaceae, or gourd family (also including pumpkins and melons), the Brassicaceae, or mustard plant family (including rapeseed and the innumerable varieties of the cabbage species Brassica oleracea), and the Apiaceae, or parsley family. Many of our fruits come from the Rutaceae, or rue family (including oranges, lemons, grapefruits, etc.), and the <a4_0>Rosaceae<a4_0/>, or rose family (including apples, pears, cherries, apricots, plums, etc.).
